units.title: Perform multiplexed immunohistochemistry on FFPE tissue sections
units.text: For each retinal organoid and the primary adult tissue, we performed multiplexed immunohistochemistry on 3-μm-thick formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded (FFPE) sections (1–4 sections per sample; Supplementary Table 1 and Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: This is a direct, actionable protocol step describing sample preparation and treatment.

units.title: Acquire tiled images at ×40 magnification with high-NA silicone oil objective
units.text: We generated tiled images at ×40 magnification with a high-numerical-aperture (NA) silicone oil objective to cover length scales from the millimeter to the nanometer scale (pixel size, 0.1625 μm) (Fig. 1c).
units.rationale: This specifies a precise imaging protocol with equipment and parameters.

units.title: Perform 21 immunohistochemical staining cycles
units.text: Here, we performed 21 immunohistochemical staining cycles.
units.rationale: This is a clear, quantified procedural step in the 4i methodology.

units.title: Stain, acquire, denoise, register, and segment nuclei in 96-well format
units.text: Stain - Acquire - Denoise - Register - Segment nuclei
units.rationale: This sequence describes a standardized workflow for image processing in the protocol.

units.title: Elute antibodies after each staining cycle
units.rationale: This is a critical, repeatable step in the iterative 4i protocol to enable multiple rounds of staining.

units.title: Perform hierarchical clustering and heat map visualization of protein expression in MTUs
units.text: Hierarchical clustering and heat map visualization of average protein expression within each MTU highlight how each protein stain associates with each MTU (Supplementary Fig. 4a).
units.rationale: This describes a computational analysis step applied to the imaging data as part of the protocol.

units.title: Visualize protein expression variance in UMAP embedding and assign cell types via scRNA-seq
units.text: Focusing on segmented nuclei in an exemplary 39-week organoid section, variance analysis in the protein expression feature space and visualization in a uniform manifold approximation and projection (UMAP) embedding revealed eight molecularly distinct nuclei clusters (Supplementary Fig. 4d,e), and comparison of protein expression with single-cell transcriptomes14 enabled cell type assignment to each nuclei cluster (Fig. 1h,i and Supplementary Fig. 4e,f).
units.rationale: This outlines a defined computational pipeline for cell type annotation using multimodal data integration.

units.title: Generate a panel of 63 antibodies across three color channels
units.text: We established a panel of 63 antibodies covering major retinal cell types, subcellular compartments, morphological structures and signaling pathways split into three color channels (Supplementary)
units.rationale: This specifies the antibody panel design, a key experimental setup in the protocol.

units.title: Apply 4i on retinal organoid timecourse (6–39 weeks) and adult retina
units.text: We applied 4i covering a timecourse of human retinal organoid development (6, 12, 18, 24 and 39 weeks; 2–4 organoids per timepoint; Supplementary Table 1) as well as an adult primary human retina (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: This defines the experimental scope and sample inclusion criteria for the protocol.

units.title: Use 96-well superstructure for immunohistological treatment and imaging
units.text: FFPE tissue sections were placed on a 96-well format coverslip that was subsequently attached to a 96-well superstructure allowing immunohistological treatment, followed by imaging and antibody elution.
units.rationale: This describes the specialized hardware setup enabling the multiplexed protocol.
